0:
```json
{
  "Model_Purpose": {
    "full_description": "The purpose of this model is to understand the impact of elites in the spread of norms as an extension of a previous model (Salimi et al. 2018). This model is not yet at a stage where it is prepared to verify and validate, so diagnostics were performed using the ANTS algorithms to look for anomalies across the parameter space. The diagnostics did not indicate problems with the current prototype model that produce erratic results or unexplained outcomes. The model is designed to test assumptions of norm diffusion theories in an environment where peer pressure is the only mechanism for punishment-based enforcement of norm adoption.",
    "research_questions": [
      "How do elites influence the diffusion of non-punishment-enforced norms through an artificial society?",
      "What is the role of peer pressure in the adoption of humanitarian norms?",
      "How does the interaction between advocates and elites affect norm adoption?"
    ],
    "system_boundaries": [],
    "outcome_variables": {
      "percent_elites": "Percentage of population who are elites (influencers) [0, 2]",
      "advocate_weight_e": "Weight advocate exerts on the elite agent’s humanitarianism values [0, 1]",
      "peer_weight_e": "Weight placed on interactions with other elite agents [0, 1]",
      "network_size": "Randomized size of network of ‘followers’ of elites [0, 500]",
      "advocate_weight_g": "Weight the advocate exerts on general agents [0, 1]",
      "elite_weight": "Weight given to a networked elite’s norm adoption [0, 1]",
      "general_weight": "Weight given to a one-on-one interaction with a general agent [0, 1]",
      "peer_weight_g": "Weight given to average humanitarian values of a group of nearby agents [0, 1]",
      "percent_advocates": "What percentage of agent population are advocates who promote a norm [0, 1]",
      "advocate_zeal": "Homogeneous value given to advocate agents’ humanitarianism values [0, 1]",
      "degrade_percent": "Amount per time step that an agent degrades its humanitarianism values, to represent donor/compassion fatigue [0, 100]",
      "mu_activist_state": "Mean humanitarianism value of all general agents (heterogeneous) [0, 1]",
      "mu_activist_threshold": "Mean threshold value of all general agents beyond which they become active humanitarian actors (heterogeneous) [0, 1]",
      "Population": "Total population of agents [500, 1000]"
    }
  }
}
```

1:
```json
{
    "Model_Purpose": {
        "full_description": "The purpose of this model is to understand the impact of elites in the spread of norms as an extension of a previous model. This model, founded predominantly on norm diffusion theory, is designed to test assumptions of norm diffusion theories in an environment where peer pressure is the only mechanism for punishment-based enforcement of norm adoption.",
        "research_questions": [
            "How do humanitarian norms that lack associated punishments for non-compliance diffuse across society?",
            "What role do elites play in the networked diffusion of social norms?",
            "How do peer pressure and the lack of formal sanctions affect norm adoption processes?"
        ],
        "system_boundaries": [],
        "outcome_variables": {
            "percent_elites": "Percentage of population who are elites (influencers)",
            "advocate_weight_e": "Weight advocate exerts on the elite agent’s humanitarianism values",
            "peer_weight_e": "Weight placed on interactions with other elite agents",
            "network_size": "Randomized size of network of ‘followers’ of elites",
            "advocate_weight_g": "Weight the advocate exerts on general agents",
            "elite_weight": "Weight given to a networked elite’s norm adoption",
            "general_weight": "Weight given to a one-on-one interaction with a general agent",
            "peer_weight_g": "Weight given to average humanitarian values of a group of nearby agents",
            "percent_advocates": "What percentage of agent population are advocates who promote a norm",
            "advocate_zeal": "Homogeneous value given to advocate agents’ humanitarianism values",
            "degrade_percent": "Amount per time step that an agent degrades its humanitarianism values, to represent donor/compassion fatigue"
        }
    }
}
```
2:
```json
{
    "Model_Purpose": {
        "full_description": "The purpose of this model is to understand the impact of elites in the spread of norms, specifically the diffusion of humanitarian norms, through an artificial society. The model is designed to test assumptions of norm diffusion theories in an environment where peer pressure is the only mechanism for punishment-based enforcement of norm adoption. It considers norm advocates who promote a norm of humanitarianism, elites who have wide networks to spread the new norm, and general individuals who evaluate the norm pushed from elites and adopted by their peers.",
        "research_questions": [
            "How do humanitarian norms that lack associated punishments for non-compliance diffuse across society?",
            "What role do networked elites play in the diffusion of non-punishment-enforced norms through an artificial society?"
        ],
        "system_boundaries": [
            "The model includes three types of agents: advocates, elites, and general individuals.",
            "The model is set in an artificial society where norm diffusion occurs through peer pressure and social networks.",
            "No punitive measures are incorporated to enforce norm adherence, focusing instead on peer pressure as a mechanism for norm adoption."
        ],
        "outcome_variables": {
            "percent_elites": "Percentage of the population who are elites (influencers)",
            "advocate_weight_e": "Weight advocate exerts on the elite agent’s humanitarianism values",
            "peer_weight_e": "Weight placed on interactions with other elite agents",
            "network_size": "Randomized size of network of 'followers' of elites",
            "advocate_weight_g": "Weight the advocate exerts on general agents",
            "elite_weight": "Weight given to a networked elite’s norm adoption",
            "general_weight": "Weight given to a one-on-one interaction with a general agent",
            "peer_weight_g": "Weight given to average humanitarian values of a group of nearby agents",
            "percent_advocates": "Percentage of agent population who are advocates who promote a norm",
            "advocate_zeal": "Homogeneous value given to advocate agents’ humanitarianism values",
            "degrade_percent": "Amount per time step that an agent degrades its humanitarianism values, to represent donor/compassion fatigue"
        }
    }
}
```
4:
```json
{
  "Model_Purpose": {
    "full_description": "The purpose of this model is to understand the impact of elites in the spread of norms as an extension of a previous model. It is designed to test assumptions of norm diffusion theories in an environment where peer pressure is the only mechanism for punishment-based enforcement of norm adoption.",
    "research_questions": [
      "How do networked elites influence the diffusion of norms within a society?",
      "What role does peer pressure play in the adoption of norms without direct enforcement or punishment?",
      "How do different types of agents, such as advocates and general individuals, contribute to norm diffusion?"
    ],
    "system_boundaries": [
      "The model focuses on the interactions between elites, advocates, and general individuals within an artificial society.",
      "The diffusion process of humanitarian norms without punishment mechanisms is considered.",
      "The internalization (and institutionalization) of norms is outside the scope of the current project."
    ],
    "outcome_variables": {
      "percent_elites": "Percentage of elite agents who adopt the norm.",
      "percent_advocates": "Percentage of advocate agents promoting the norm.",
      "degrade_percent": "Amount per time step that an agent degrades its humanitarian values, to represent donor/compassion fatigue.",
      "mu_activist_state": "Mean humanitarianism value of all general agents.",
      "mu_activist_threshold": "Mean threshold value of all general agents beyond which they become active humanitarian actors.",
      "Population": "Total population of agents in the simulation.",
      "peer_weight_g": "Weight given to average humanitarian values of a group of nearby agents by general agents.",
      "elite_weight": "Weight given to a networked elite’s norm adoption by general agents."
    }
  }
}
```

9:
```json
{
    "Model_Purpose": {
        "full_description": "The purpose of this model is to understand the impact of elites in the spread of norms, specifically humanitarian norms, as an extension of previous models. The model is designed to test assumptions of norm diffusion theories in an environment where peer pressure is the only mechanism for punishment-based enforcement of norm adoption.",
        "research_questions": [
            "How do humanitarian norms, lacking associated punishments for non-compliance, diffuse across society?",
            "What is the role of elites in the diffusion of social norms of humanitarianism?",
            "How does peer pressure influence norm adoption in the absence of enforced punishments?"
        ],
        "system_boundaries": [
            "The model includes three types of agents: elites, advocates, and the general population.",
            "The agents interact in an artificial society to simulate norm diffusion through repeated interactions."
        ],
        "outcome_variables": {
            "percent_elites": "Percentage of the population who are elites (influencers).",
            "advocate_weight_e": "Weight advocate exerts on the elite agent's humanitarianism values.",
            "peer_weight_e": "Weight placed on interactions with other elite agents.",
            "network_size": "Randomized size of the network of 'followers' of elites.",
            "advocate_weight_g": "Weight the advocate exerts on general agents.",
            "elite_weight": "Weight given to a networked elite's norm adoption.",
            "general_weight": "Weight given to a one-on-one interaction with a general agent.",
            "peer_weight_g": "Weight given to average humanitarian values of a group of nearby agents.",
            "percent_advocates": "Percentage of agent population that are advocates who promote a norm.",
            "advocate_zeal": "Homogeneous value given to advocate agents' humanitarianism values.",
            "degrade_percent": "Amount per time step that an agent degrades its humanitarianism values, representing donor/compassion fatigue."
        }
    }
}
```
